Parameters: true if the route is secure, false otherwise

getLayerType().Description: Obtains the layering type of this route. In the presence of proxies, only layering over an end-to-end tunnel is considered.

isLayered().Description: Checks whether this route includes a layered protocol. In the presence of proxies, only layering over an end-to-end tunnel is considered.

Parameters: true if the route is secure, false otherwise
connectProxy(org.apache.http.HttpHost, b.Description: Tracks connecting to the first proxy.
connectProxy(org.apache.http.HttpHost, b.FullName: public final void connectProxy (HttpHost proxy, boolean secure)

Parameters: the host to which to route
the local address to route from, or null for the default
RouteTracker(org.apache.http.HttpHost, j.Description: Creates a new route tracker. The target and origin need to be specified at creation time.

Returns: the tracked route, or null if nothing has been tracked so far
toRoute().Description: Obtains the tracked route. If a route has been tracked, it is @B_org#apache#http#conn#routing#RouteTracker#isConnected_E@. If not connected, nothing has been tracked so far.

Returns: true if the argument is the same tracked route, false
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares this tracked route to another.

Returns: true if tunnelled end-to-end through at least one proxy, false otherwise
isTunnelled().Description: Checks whether this route is tunnelled through a proxy. If there is a proxy chain, only end-to-end tunnels are considered.

clone().Description: Creates and returns a copy of this Object. The default implementation returns a so-called "shallow" copy: It creates a new instance of the same class and then copies the field values (including object references) from this instance to the new instance. A "deep" copy, in contrast, would also recursively clone nested objects. A subclass that needs to implement this kind of cloning should call super.clone() to create the new instance and then create deep copies of the nested, mutable objects.

Parameters: true if the route is secure, false otherwise
tunnelProxy(org.apache.http.HttpHost, bo.Description: Tracks tunnelling to a proxy in a proxy chain. This will extend the tracked proxy chain, but it does not mark the route as tunnelled. Only end-to-end tunnels are considered there.
tunnelProxy(org.apache.http.HttpHost, bo.FullName: public final void tunnelProxy (HttpHost proxy, boolean secure)

hashCode().Description: Generates a hash code for this tracked route. Route trackers are modifiable and should therefore not be used as lookup keys. Use @B_org#apache#http#conn#routing#RouteTracker#toRoute_E@ to obtain an unmodifiable representation of the tracked route.

RouteTracker(org.apache.http.conn.routin.Description: Creates a new tracker for the given route. Only target and origin are taken from the route, everything else remains to be tracked.

Parameters: true if the route is secure, false otherwise

getLocalAddress().Description: Obtains the local address to connect from.

getTunnelType().Description: Obtains the tunnel type of this route. If there is a proxy chain, only end-to-end tunnels are considered.

Returns: the first proxy in the proxy chain, or null if this route is direct
a human-readable representation of the tracked route
toString().Description: Obtains a description of the tracked route.

Returns: the target of the given hop
Parameters: index of the hop for which to get the target, 0 for first
getHopTarget(int).Description: Obtains the target of a hop in this route. The target of the last hop is the @B_org#apache#http#conn#routing#RouteInfo#getTargetHost_E@, the target of previous hops is the respective proxy in the chain. For a route through exactly one proxy, target of hop 0 is the proxy and target of hop 1 is the target host.

Returns: the number of hops in this route
getHopCount().Description: Obtains the number of hops in this route. A direct route has one hop. A route through a proxy has two hops. A route through a chain of

isSecure().Description: Checks whether this route is secure.

Parameters: true if the route is secure, false otherwise
